questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a stage of labor?
What is the term for the rhythmic tightening of the uterus that helps dilate the cervix?
Which stage of labor involves the delivery of the placenta?
What is the term for the thinning and softening of the cervix during labor?
At what dilation is the cervix considered fully dilated?
Which of the following is a sign of true labor?
choices: Contractions that stop when you change position
Contractions that are irregular in timing
Contractions that increase in intensity over time
Pain only in the lower back
questions.answer: Contractions that increase in intensity over time

questions.question: What is the most intense part of labor, typically occurring at the end of the first stage?
Which hormone plays a crucial role in initiating and maintaining labor?
What is the term for the baby's position with the head down and facing the mother's back?
Which of the following is NOT a common intervention during labor?
What is the purpose of using a doll and pelvis model in doula training?
Which of the following is a sign that labor may be starting soon?
What is the average length of active labor for a first-time mother?
Which of the following is NOT a physiological change during labor?
What is the term for the baby's head entering the pelvic inlet?
Which of the following positions is often recommended during labor to help with fetal descent?
What is the purpose of watching and discussing videos of natural births in doula training?
choices: To familiarize students with the birth process
To teach students how to operate video equipment
questions.answer: To familiarize students with the birth process

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common emotional change during labor?
What is the term for the expulsion of the baby from the uterus?
Which of the following is a sign that labor is progressing well?
choices: Cervical dilation progressing at about 1 cm per hour
questions.answer: Cervical dilation progressing at about 1 cm per hour

questions.question: What is the purpose of the placenta during pregnancy?
choices: To provide nutrients to the baby
questions.answer: To provide nutrients to the baby

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a method to assess the progress of labor?
What is the term for the baby's head becoming visible at the vaginal opening during birth?
Which of the following is a potential benefit of allowing labor to start naturally?
What is the primary role of a doula during labor?
choices: To make decisions for the mother
To provide continuous emotional and physical support
questions.answer: To provide continuous emotional and physical support

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common comfort measure used during labor?
What is the term for the separation of the placenta from the uterine wall?
Which of the following is a sign that the second stage of labor (pushing) is beginning?
What is the purpose of the amniotic fluid during labor?
choices: To provide nutrition to the baby
To cushion and protect the baby
questions.answer: To cushion and protect the baby

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical emotional support technique used by doulas during labor?
